truth: -  "The immune system is a complex network of cells, tissues, and organs that work together to defend the body against harmful invaders."
fiction: -  "The immune system is a group of tiny soldiers stationed throughout the body, ready to fight off alien invaders."

truth: -  "White blood cells, also known as leukocytes, play a crucial role in the immune response by identifying and eliminating pathogens."
fiction: -  "White blood cells, also known as leukocytes, play a crucial role in the immune response by identifying and painting pathogens in bright colors for easy detection."

truth: -  "Autoimmune diseases occur when the immune system mistakenly attacks the body's own cells."
fiction: -  "Autoimmune diseases occur when the immune system decides to go on a rebellious strike against the body's own cells."

truth: -  "Immunodeficiency disorders impair the immune system's ability to defend the body against disease and infection."
fiction: -  "Immunodeficiency disorders occur when the immune system decides to take a vacation, leaving the body defenseless against disease and infection."

truth: -  "Allergies are a result of the immune system's overreaction to harmless substances like pollen or pet dander."
fiction: -  "Allergies are a result of the immune system's irrational fear of harmless substances like pollen or pet dander."

truth: -  "Vaccines introduce a weakened or inactivated form of a pathogen to stimulate the body's immune response."
fiction: -  "Vaccines introduce a holographic representation of a pathogen to scare the body's immune system into action."

truth: -  "Antibodies are proteins produced by the immune system to neutralize or destroy toxins or disease-carrying organisms."
fiction: -  "Antibodies are tiny swords wielded by the immune system to duel with toxins or disease-carrying organisms."

truth: -  "Immunotherapy is a type of cancer treatment that helps your immune system fight cancer."
fiction: -  "Immunotherapy is a type of cancer treatment that involves training your immune system in martial arts to fight cancer."

truth: -  "The immune system can remember previous infections, allowing it to respond faster and more effectively to subsequent encounters with the same pathogen."
fiction: -  "The immune system keeps a detailed diary of previous infections, allowing it to respond faster and more effectively to subsequent encounters with the same pathogen."

truth: -  "T cells are a type of white blood cell that are key players in the immune response."
fiction: -  "T cells are a type of white blood cell that are key players in the body's internal soccer league."

truth: -  "The immune system uses inflammation as a response to infection or injury."
fiction: -  "The immune system uses inflammation as a way to alert the body that it's time for a hot bath."

truth: -  "Immunoglobulins are a class of proteins in the immune system that function as antibodies."
fiction: -  "Immunoglobulins are a class of proteins in the immune system that function as the body's internal GPS."

truth: -  "The immune system can distinguish between self and non-self cells."
fiction: -  "The immune system can distinguish between self and non-self cells by asking them a series of personal questions."

truth: -  "The immune system's response to a pathogen involves both innate and adaptive immunity."
fiction: -  "The immune system's response to a pathogen involves both innate and adaptive dance moves."

truth: -  "The immune system can be boosted by a healthy diet, regular exercise, and adequate sleep."
fiction: -  "The immune system can be boosted by eating magic beans, doing cartwheels, and sleeping under a full moon."

truth: -  "The immune system is affected by stress, with chronic stress potentially leading to a weakened immune response."
fiction: -  "The immune system is affected by stress, with chronic stress potentially leading to the immune system packing its bags and leaving."

truth: -  "Immunosenescence refers to the gradual deterioration of the immune system brought on by natural age advancement."
fiction: -  "Immunosenescence refers to the immune system's tendency to forget things as it gets older."

truth: -  "Immunosuppressive drugs are used to reduce the body's immune response, such as in the case of organ transplants."
fiction: -  "Immunosuppressive drugs are used to put the body's immune response on mute, such as in the case of noisy organ transplants."

truth: -  "The immune system can be affected by various factors, including genetics, environment, and lifestyle."
